New Records: Pakistan reached the T20 World Cup final for the first time since 2009.
Daryl Mitchell appeared in two T20 World Cup semi-finals, scoring 72 not out against England in 2021 and 53 not out against Pakistan in 2022.
Key Match Events: Pakistan's bowlers allowed New Zealand only 12 boundaries in 20 overs.
Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan formed a century partnership, contributing 105 runs together.
Pakistan won by seven wickets with five balls to spare.
New Zealand finished with 152 runs for the loss of four wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand won the toss and chose to bat first.
The match was significant for Pakistan, who otherwise would not have reached the final without the Netherlands' unexpected win over South Africa.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson acknowledged Pakistan's superior performance.
Babar Azam praised his team's bowlers and the overall team effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions were described as not looking their best.
The match had a large attendance, with 36,443 spectators.
Others: Social media reactions and the match's impact on the tournament progression were mentioned.
